domosaics.ui.views.view.components
Interface ViewComponent

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractViewComponent, DomainArrangementComponent, DomainComponent
public interface ViewComponent

View components represent the graphical component for backend data models rendered within a view.

Examples for ViewComponents are NodeComponent in trees and ArrangementComponent for representing domain arrangements.

Each view component is in general managed by a ComponentManager mapping the backend data to the graphical component.

During the layout process each ViewComponent is assigned to its correct position on the view panel. Therefore various methods are needed to let layouter classes set the position for the view component. All those methods are defined in this interface.

The basic implementation for this interface is AbstractViewComponent and view components like ArrangementComponent just extend the basic implementation.

Author:
Andreas Held

Method Summary
 java.awt.Shape getBoundingShape()
          Returns the bounding shape of this component.
 java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D getBounds()
          Returns the bounds of this component, where X,Y is the anchor point and therefore not necessarily the upper left corner.
 java.awt.Shape getDisplayedShape()
          Returns the actual displayed shape for this component, which is used for mouse events to determine whether or not the component was clicked on.

Method Detail

setBounds

void setBounds(int x,
               int y,
               int width,
               int height)
Sets the new bounds for this component. This method should also set the new bounding shape for the bounds. Look into AbstractViewComponent.setBounds(int, int, int, int) for details.

Parameters:
x - the x coordinate of the anchor point.
y - the y coordinate of the anchor point.
width - components width
height - components height

getLocation

java.awt.Point getLocation()
Returns the Position of the components anchor point.

Position of the components anchor point

getBounds

java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D getBounds()
Returns the bounds of this component, where X,Y is the anchor point and therefore not necessarily the upper left corner.

Returns:
Bounds of this component

getRelativeBounds

java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D.Double getRelativeBounds()
Returns the relative bounds of this component, which can be used during the layout process.

Changes on the relative bounds are done by using this method. For example node.getRelativeBounds().y = newY;

Returns:
components relative bounds

getBoundingShape

java.awt.Shape getBoundingShape()
Returns the bounding shape of this component.

This can be used to determine if the component intersects with the clipping area and therefore has to be drawn during the rendering process.

Returns:
the bounding shape of this component

getDisplayedShape

java.awt.Shape getDisplayedShape()
Returns the actual displayed shape for this component, which is used for mouse events to determine whether or not the component was clicked on.

Returns:
the currently displayed shape of this component.
